groups.description: List of group names which include one or more selected nodes.

keys.description: Lists of selected node keys which are part of the groups in the 'groups' list.

kinds.description: Lists of selected node kinds which are part of the groups in the 'groups' list.

items.description: Groups of the primary kind node.

data.description: The data which is displayed in each column of the search result.

items.description: Data source for the column (e.g. 1:n:name - Name of starting nodes, 3:e:key - Key of edge traversed in the second traversal).

format.description: All column format definitions of the search result.

items.description: Column format as specified in the show format (e.g. text).

labels.description: All column labels of the search result.

items.description: Columns of a row of the query result.
A single cell of the query result (string, integer or null).

sources.description: Data sources of the query result.

items.description: Columns of a row of the query result.
Data source of a single cell of the query result.

info.description: Query and modify the EliasDB datastore.
info.title: EliasDB API

get.description: Returns available API versions, product name and product version.

product.description: Product name of the REST API provider.

version.description: Version of the REST API provider.

get.summary: Return information about the REST API provider.

post.description: The blob endpoint can be used to store binary data. Its location will be automatically allocated.

parameters.description: The data to store.
parameters.name: data

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

id.description: The data ID which can be used to lookup the data.

post.summary: Create a binary blob of data.

delete.description: The blob endpoint can be used to remove binary data from a specific location.

parameters.description: ID of the binary blob.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

delete.summary: Remove a binary blob of data.

get.description: The blob endpoint can be used to retrieve binary data from a specific location.

parameters.description: ID of the binary blob.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

get.summary: Retrieve a binary blob of data.

put.description: The blob endpoint can be used to update binary data at a specific location.

parameters.description: ID of the binary blob.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

put.summary: Update a binary blob of data.

get.description: The cluster endpoint returns the cluster state info which contains cluster members and their state.

delete.description: A delete call to the log endpoint resets the cluster related log and clears the ring buffer in memory.

get.description: The cluster log endpoint returns the latest cluster related log messages from a memory ring buffer.
get.summary: Return latest cluster related log messages.

get.description: The memberinfos returns the static member info of every known cluster member. If a member is not reachable its info contains a single key-value pair with the key error and an error message as value.

200.description: A map of memberinfos (keys are member names).

get.summary: Return static member info of every known cluster member.

put.description: The cluster can be controlled via this command endpoint on any member.

parameters.description: Valid commands are: ping, join and eject.
parameters.name: command

parameters.description: Arguments for a command
parameters.name: args

name.description: Name of a cluster member (ping/join=member to contact, eject=member to eject).

netaddr.description: Network address of a member e.g. localhost:9030 (ping/join=member address to contact)

200.description: Only the ping command returns its result. All other positive responses are empty.

put.summary: Commands can be given to the cluster by using PUT requests.

post.description: The eql endpoint should be used to parse a given EQL query into an Abstract Syntax Tree or pretty print a given Abstract Syntax Tree into an EQL query.

parameters.description: Query or AST which should be converted.
parameters.name: data

ast.description: AST which should be pretty printed.
The resulting AST if a query was parsed.

query.description: The pretty printed query if an AST was given.

post.summary: EQL parser and pretty printer endpoint.

get.description: The find endpoint should be used to run simple index searches for either a value or a phrase.

parameters.description: A word or phrase to search for.
parameters.name: text

parameters.description: A node value to search for.
parameters.name: value

parameters.description: Flag if a complete node lookup should be done (otherwise only key and kind are returned).
parameters.name: lookup

parameters.description: Limit the search to a partition (without the option all partitions are searched).
parameters.name: part

get.summary: Run index searches on the EliasDB datastore.

post.description: A whole graph can be send. POST will store data in the datastore and always overwrite any existing data.

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Nodes and Edges which should be stored
parameters.name: entities

edges.description: List of edges to be inserted / updated.

nodes.description: List of nodes to be inserted / updated.

200.description: No data is returned when data is created.

post.summary: Data can be send by using POST requests.

post.description: A list of nodes / edges can be send. POST will store data in the datastore and always overwrite any existing data.

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Datastore entity type which should selected. Either n for nodes or e for edges.
parameters.name: entity_type

parameters.description: Nodes or Edges which should be stored
parameters.name: entities

items.description: Node or edge to be inserted / updated.

200.description: No data is returned when data is created.

post.summary: Data can be send by using POST requests.

get.description: GET requests can be used to query a series of nodes. The X-Total-Count header contains the total number of nodes which were found.

parameters.description: Node or edge kind to be queried.
parameters.name: kind

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Datastore entity type which should selected. Either n for nodes or e for edges.
parameters.name: entity_type

parameters.description: How many list items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset in the dataset.
parameters.name: offset

200.description: The return data is a list of objects

get.summary: The graph endpoint is the main entry point to request data.

get.description: GET requests can be used to query a single node.

parameters.description: Node or edge kind to be queried.
parameters.name: kind

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Datastore entity type which should selected. Either n for nodes or e for edges.
parameters.name: entity_type

parameters.description: Node or edge key to be queried.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: How many list items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset in the dataset.
parameters.name: offset

200.description: The return data is a single object

get.summary: The graph endpoint is the main entry point to request data.

get.description: GET requests can be used to query a single node and then traverse to its neighbours.

parameters.description: Node or edge kind to be queried.
parameters.name: kind

parameters.description: Partition to select.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Datastore entity type which should selected. Either n for nodes or e for edges.
parameters.name: entity_type

parameters.description: Node or edge key to be queried.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: Traversal to be followed from a single node.
parameters.name: traversal_spec

200.description: The return data are two lists containing traversed nodes and edges. The traversal endpoint does NOT support limit and offset parameters. Also the X-Total-Count header is not set.

get.summary: The graph endpoint is the main entry point to request data.

get.description: The index endpoint should be used to run index searches for either a word, phrase or a whole value. All queries must specify a kind and an node/edge attribute.

parameters.description: Partition to query.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: Datastore entity type which should selected. Either n for nodes or e for edges.
parameters.name: entity_type

parameters.description: Node or edge kind to be queried.
parameters.name: kind

parameters.description: Attribute which should contain the word, phrase or value.
parameters.name: attr

parameters.description: Word to search for in word queries.
parameters.name: word

parameters.description: Phrase to search for in phrase queries.
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: Value (node/edge attribute value) to search for in value queries.
parameters.name: value

200.description: A list of keys or when doing a word search a map with node/edge key to word positions.

get.summary: Run index searches on the EliasDB datastore.

get.description: The info endpoint returns general database information such as known node kinds, known attributes, etc.
The info kind endpoint returns information on a given node kind such as known attributes and edges.

parameters.description: Node or edge kind to be queried.
parameters.name: kind

get.summary: Return information on a given node or edge kind.

get.description: The query endpoint should be used to run EQL search queries against partitions. The return value is always a list (even if there is only a single entry). A query result gets an ID and is stored in a cache. The ID is returned in the X-Cache-Id header. Subsequent requests for the same result can use the ID instead of a query.

parameters.description: Partition to query.
parameters.name: partition

parameters.description: URL encoded query to execute.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Result ID to retrieve from the result cache.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: How many list items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset in the dataset.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Include group information in the result if set to any value.
parameters.name: groups

get.summary: Run EQL queries to query the EliasDB datastore.

get.description: The csv endpoint is used to generate a CSV string from the search result.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

get.summary: Return the search result in CSV format.

get.description: Returns the current selections state which contains all selected nodes which are in groups.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

get.summary: Get the current group selection state.

post.description: Sets the groups in the given selection state.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: Group seletion state of a query result
parameters.name: selection_state

200.description: Current group selection state after the operation.

post.summary: Set a new group selection state.

delete.description: The groupselected endpoint is used to remove all selected nodes (primary node of each row) from the given (existing) group.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: Name of an existing group.
parameters.name: group_name

200.description: Current group selection state after the operation.

delete.summary: Remove all selected nodes (primary node of each row) from the given group.

put.description: The groupselected endpoint is used to add all selected nodes (primary node of each row) to the given (existing) group.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: Name of an existing group.
parameters.name: group_name

200.description: Current group selection state after the operation.

put.summary: Add all selected nodes (primary node of each row) to the given group.

get.description: The quickfilter endpoint is used to determine the 10 most frequent used values in a particular result column.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: Column of the query result.
parameters.name: column

parameters.description: Limit the maximum number of result items.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: An object containing values and frequencies.

get.summary: Return quickfilter information on a given result column.

get.description: The select endpoint is used to query all selected nodes of a given query result.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

get.summary: Return the (primary) nodes which are currently selected.

put.description: The select endpoint is used to select one or more rows of a given query result.

parameters.description: Result ID of a query result.
parameters.name: rid

parameters.description: Row number of the query result or 'all', 'none' or 'invert'.
parameters.name: row

put.summary: Selects one or more rows of a given query result.
